intro: Nototriche obcuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved nototriche, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, and the flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in clusters. Nototriche obcuneata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
